svcproc.title: Crankshaft Position (CKP) Sensor
svcproc.para: The CKP sensor is a magnetic pickup sensor that provides the Electronic Control Module (ECM) with a signal that indicates crankshaft speed and position. As the crankshaft turns, the CKP sensor detects a 60-tooth timing disk on the crankshaft. Teeth 59 and 60 are missing. By comparing the CKP signal with the Camshaft Position (CMP) signal, the ECM calculates engine rpm and timing requirements. The CKP sensor is installed in the front right side of the lower crankcase.

note.para: When ordering this sensor, make sure the sensor is the same one pictured. This sensor is used in different International Truck and Engine Corporation applications to sense camshaft position.
